Restore NA Information Within Processed Results

Source: R/replace_outliers.R
restore_na.Rd

Restores NA values to their original vector positions after processing non-NA values.

Usage

restore_na(y, na_info)

Arguments

y

A numeric vector of non-NA output values within a function.

na_info

A list returned by preserve_na.

Value

A numeric vector of the original input vector length with NA values restored to their original positions.

See also

preserve_na

Examples

x <- c(1, NA, 3, NA, 5)
na_info <- preserve_na(x)
processed <- na_info$x_clean * 2  # Process clean values
result <- restore_na(processed, na_info)
# Returns: c(2, NA, 6, NA, 10)
